title: Add Branching to Go SDK katas
body:
This pull requests adds a Branching lesson to the Go SDK katas. I would like to request the following reviewers: (R: @lostluck ) (R: @henryken ) Note that I deviated from the Java Branching lesson since I felt the output was clearer coming from different transforms. If accepted by both reviewers, please wait until the [Stepik course](https://stepik.org/course/70387) is updated before finally merging this PR. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-6110] Avoid unnecessary window configuration for GlobalWindows in BeamCoGBKJoinRel
body:
To ensure correctness, https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/7115 added the `Window.configure()` step to set timestamp combiner. This change has caused performance regression for some CalciteSQL pipelines. To restrict the impact, this PR makes sure the `Window.configure()` step is not applied when it is not necessary. r: @kennknowles Post-Commit Tests Status (on master branch) ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Lang | SDK | Dataflow | Flink | Samza | Spark | Twister2 --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- Go | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Spark/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Spark/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- Java | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/) | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/)

title: Remove incorrect import which causes tests to fail
body:
Remove the `import static com.sun.tools.doclint.Entity.times` statement. Its an internal class that causes tests one some JVMs to fail and is not needed (no idea how it passed my local or presubmit tests!) title: [BEAM-9890] Try fixing BIT_AND(NULL) issue
body:
R: @amaliujia Modified the original implementation of BitAnd class by adding a boolean value "isEmpty" to indicate if inputs don't contain any valid numerical values. Also added some tests to test NULL values. The current situation is: 1. When table is empty, the result is empty, correct. 2. When table contains only null values, the result is null, correct. 3. When table contains only valid numerical values, the result is as expected, correct. 4. When table contains both valid numerical values and null values, the result should be null, but it seems all null values have been directly ignored before doing the bit_and operation. Only numerical values are taken into operation, so the result is incorrect. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [X] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Interactive Environment Inspector for messaging
body:
1. Added messaging package to expose interactive environment state through a singleton interactive environment inspector. 2. Added a to_json util to convert native python objects to json string for messaging. 3. Applications can use the inspector's API to communicate with a running kernel. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10334] Increase default grpc message length
body:
The default limit of a grpc message is set low to 4 MB, and is not overridden in the sdk_worker.py for the _control_channel. This was first discovered when submitting a beam job via a flink operator orchestrated by kubernetes. This was fixed by modifying the options parameter to allow any size grpc message to be sent or received. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10303] Add support for the non-window observing optimization to DoFn execution in portable Beam Java
body:
The idea for the optimization is that if we don't observe the window then we don't need to process each element in each individual window. We could make this better by making it dynamically figured out instead of statically during initialization but this change brings us up to what is implemented in the non-portable Java runner libraries. This covers all but the splittable DoFn processElements call since I wanted to limit the size of the change and that one will be more involved. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10336,BEAM-10337] Add SchemaIO abstraction and implement for PubSub
body:
Created a schema capable IO abstraction interface and implemented for pubsub. Involves a SchemaIOProvider to instantiate the SchemaIO, which can be used to create schema aware reader and writer transforms. title: [BEAM-9935] Counting empty split points as "any" in Go DataSource.
body:
Fix a small oversight in the split code. I check for nil to mean any splits are ok, but if the list is empty instead of nil it should have the same behavior. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Disable defensive_copy by default in InMemoryUnmergedState
body:
Disable defensive_copy by default in InMemoryUnmergedState Defensive copy results in lulls with the following stack trace: File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/runpy.py", line 193, in _run_module_as_main "__main__", mod_spec) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/runpy.py", line 85, in _run_code exec(code, run_globals) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/dataflow_worker/start.py", line 144, in main() File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/dataflow_worker/start.py", line 140, in main batchworker.BatchWorker(properties, sdk_pipeline_options).run() File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/dataflow_worker/batchworker.py", line 843, in run deferred_exception_details=deferred_exception_details) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/dataflow_worker/batchworker.py", line 647, in do_work work_executor.execute() File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/dataflow_worker/executor.py", line 179, in execute op.start() File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/apache_beam/transforms/trigger.py", line 1172, in process_elements for output in uncombined: File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/apache_beam/transforms/trigger.py", line 1280, in process_elements state.add_state(window, self.WATERMARK_HOLD, output_time) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/apache_beam/transforms/trigger.py", line 941, in add_state self.raw_state.add_state(self._get_id(window), tag, value) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/apache_beam/transforms/trigger.py", line 998, in _get_id self._persist_window_ids() File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/apache_beam/transforms/trigger.py", line 1013, in _persist_window_ids self.raw_state.set_global_state(self.WINDOW_IDS, self.window_ids) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/apache_beam/transforms/trigger.py", line 1404, in set_global_state value = copy.deepcopy(value) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/copy.py", line 150, in deepcopy y = copier(x, memo) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/copy.py", line 241, in _deepcopy_dict y[deepcopy(key, memo)] = deepcopy(value, memo) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/copy.py", line 150, in deepcopy y = copier(x, memo) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/copy.py", line 216, in _deepcopy_list append(deepcopy(a, memo)) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/copy.py", line 141, in deepcopy d = id(x) ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10313] Add without_defaults to built-in Combiners in Python
body:
Following with [BEAM-10209](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-10209) that fixed `Mean` When need Windows and built-in combiners in a Globally way, we cannot specify `without_defaults()`, forcing us to use the workaround as `CombineGlobally(CountCombineFn()).without_defaults()`. This PR fix this, adding the `without_defaults()` to built-in Combiners in Python ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Adding Jenkins job cleaning the /tmp directory on Jenkins node machine
body:
That PR adds DSL definition of a job that could be used to manually clean /tmp directory on Jenkins nodes. Committers will be able to manually trigger the build and clean the /tmp. Cleaning is not just simple deleting everything. It deletes only the files which were not accessed during the last 10 hours. That period of time is also configurable. The reason behind that is to make the other executing jobs on the same machine safe. There is no need to run that job periodically as another, similar mechanism will be introduced as a crontab task on each machine. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-9932] Add documentation describing cross-language test pipelines
body:
Added documentation, to both the [java](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/master/runners/core-construction-java/src/test/java/org/apache/beam/runners/core/construction/ValidateRunnerXlangTest.java) and [python](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/master/sdks/python/apache_beam/transforms/validate_runner_xlang_test.py) equivalents, explaining the design of the test suite tasked with validating a cross-language runner. title: [BEAM-10306] Add latency measurements to Python Flink load test
body:

title: [BEAM-10294] using SparkMetricsContainerStepMap for readable metrics presentation in Spark history server UI
body:
Beam metrics in Spark history server are not readable because now they're rendered as protobuffer formatted as JSON where metric's value is stored in `bytes` field. Using already existing `SparkMetricsContainerStepMap` which overrides `toString()` method by calling `SparkBeamMetric.renderAll()` method. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-10305] Let InMemoryBagUserStateFactory only use a single cache token
body:
When the state cache is enabled in the Python SDK, the batch mode of the Flink Runner currently only allows a single user state cell because a new cache token is generated for each state cell; the caching code in the Python SDK Harness only supports one cache token per user state handler. Theoretically multiple cache tokens would work but would just be adding to the payload. We should make sure to just send a single cache token in batch mode (which is already the case in streaming) Post-Commit Tests Status (on master branch) ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Lang | SDK | Dataflow | Flink | Samza | Spark --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- Go | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Spark/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Spark/lastCompletedBuild/) Java | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/) | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/)

title: [BEAM-4634] Add options to allow BigQuery StandardSQL queries.
body:
Currently, the Go SDK `bigqueryio`package is stuck in LegacySQL mode. This limits the type of queries developers can write the and types of tables they can query. To allow developers to switch to Standard SQL mode, we introduce a `QueryOptions` struct which can be passed. Future work could reuse this struct to also control validation and flattening, mirroring the Python and Java Bigquery IO packages. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-10298] beam-linkage-check.sh should not swallow errors
body:
sdks/java/build-tools/beam-linkage-check.sh does not show errors when it fails. It's because it sends errors to dev/null. https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/11919#discussion_r443612255 Furthermore, the empty invocation to install artifacts to Maven local is no longer required. It was just to make clean text diff in subsequent checkJavaLinkage invocations. We now use XML files to filter existing linkage errors. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-10292] DefaultFilenamePolicy.ParamsCoder is not able to decode directory on the local file system
body:
`DefaultFilenamePolicy.ParamsCoder` used `StringUtf8Coder` for encoding/decoding `baseFilename` and therefore information whether `baseFilename resourceID` is file or directory was lost. Using `ResourceIdCoder` instead fixes this issue. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-10399] Periodic clear of GCS wheels staging bucket
body:
Once per month clear GCS folders which do not have corresponding branches. > About cleaning up these GCS locations I consider two options: > - setting lifecycle management on the bucket which will delete files older than some arbitrary age, e.g. 365 days. I think advantage of this is that will be maintenance free. > - creating another scheduled workflow on github actions which will delete gcs folders if corresponding branch does not exist anymore. Could be scheduled to run e.g. once pre week. https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/11877#discussion_r436067638 https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/11877#discussion_r442594989 ### Before merging Before merging it is required to setup related secrets: * `GCP_PROJECT_ID` ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-10285] Fix Dataflow-based Jenkins jobs
body:
This PR adds `TestDataflowRunner` as a separate option in `CommonTestProperties.groovy`. Some of the jobs require the Test runner to properly execute, while others require the normal runner. Addition of the Test runner will allow both types to run without problems. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-10290] Add a unit(ish) test for dynamic splitting correctness.

title: [BEAM-9962] Jenkins Plugin
body:
Problem and Proposed Solution: Current production usage of Beam doesn't have any recommendation for launching production pipelines. This leads to inconsistent and non repeatable pipeline launch. Therefore, we wanted to write a Jenkins plugin to build any Apache Beam pipeline (using Python, Gradle, or Maven) and launch the pipeline on the Dataflow runner. Currently working: - get configurations from user: Java or Python, Gradle (show added build task) or Maven - run pipeline on Dataflow using Maven or Gradle - run pipeline on Dataflow using Python Run tests: mvn test ------------------------ Post-Commit Tests Status (on master branch) ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Lang | SDK | Apex | Dataflow | Flink | Samza | Spark --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- Go | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | --- | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Spark/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Spark/lastCompletedBuild/) Java | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/) | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Apex/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Apex/lastCompletedBuild/) | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/)

title: [BEAM-10286] Fix race in direct runner
body:
There is a race between checking `visibleUpdates` and `pipelineState` that leads to updates being dropped. This fixes that race. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-5853] Trigger autodeploy on commit ID and image tag mismatch

body:

title: [BEAM-10267] ZetaSQLCalc makes grpc call per row
body:
I like to delete code. This is a large performance improvement, it is 4.2x as fast on Nexmark Query 0, 4.7x on Query 13. Instead of a separate query for `condition` and each `column` the query looks like this: `CASE WHEN condition THEN ROW(column1, column2, ...) ELSE NULL END` ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-10220] Add support for REQUIRE_MISSING in RowJsonDeserializer, Make ACCEPT_MISSING_OR_NULL the default behavior.
body:
Adds a third option, REQUIRE_MISSING, where we throw an error if there's a null value. Only a missing field can encode an error. This also tweaks RowJsonTest so we can re-use ValueTest to exercise the new options. title: Add flag to skip javadocJar in MavenJar publication
body:
We run some internal tests against the output of `publishMavenJavaPublicationTotestPublicationLocalRepository`. These tests do not require the javadoc jar, but it takes about 20% of the build time. We can skip building them with `-x javadocJar` but then publish fails. This change adds a flag so publish does not fail. I don't like adding flags like this (feels like mvn all over again!) so I would love better ideas. I want someone who does not work for Google to evaluate how much they dislike this flag. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [n/a] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [n/a] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10273] Fix sql_test failure in python 2
body:
Using `str` for schemas only works in python 3, for compatibility with both py 2 and 3 we need to use `future.builtins.unicode`. title: [BEAM-9179] Refactor Beam ZetaSQL type translation code
body:
This PR refactors Beam ZetaSQL type translation code. After the refactor: **ZetaSqlBeamTranslationUtils.java** contains utility methods for translation between ZetaSQL and Beam. **ZetaSqlCalciteTranslationUtils.java** contains utility methods for translation between ZetaSQL and Calcite. r: @robinyqiu cc: @apilloud ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-9164] Unify watermark emission timer registration in UnboundedSourceWrapper
body:
Every execution branch in `UnboundedSourceWrapper` had its own watermark timer registration code. This caused the `UnboundedSourceWrapperTest` to be flaky on Jenkins because there would be a race condition between the initial registration of the watermark emission timer and the processing time advancement in the test which ensures that the timer is triggered. Moving the timer registration code before the reader initialization code removes the race condition. title: [BEAM-9066] Add javax.annotation-api dependency.
body:
As of jdk-9 only non-EE modules are present by default including those like the javax.annotation.Generated annotations which are required for generated code with grpc et al. Adding this as a compileOnly dependency prepares Beam for Java 11. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: Migrating to new CI - Beam Jenkins Master
body:
That change applies the migration of the CI services to the new Beam Jenkins Master available at https://ci-beam.apache.org/. It replaces the URLs to Jenkins instance across the whole repository. Merge of this change should be synchronized with the switch of the responsibility of PR/Commit/Phrase builds to the new CI. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: Lump together PMC-only steps in release guide
body:
Re-arrange release guide so all of the PMC-only steps are together. When I encountered these I ended up having to ping a PMC twice since I didn't read ahead. Also removes the direction to copy artifacts to archive.apache.org, since this happens automatically. title: [BEAM-10341] Support drain in python and java SDF
body:
**Please** add a meaningful description for your change here ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Clarify release guide for publishing release notes to GitHub
body:
- Move GitHub release note publication after merging the blog post, since the script reads from the blog post. - Change command to first cd into `beam/release/src/main/scripts`. Otherwise sourcing script.config fails. Also added a commit here to change `git push upstream` to `git push origin`. title: Fix default in 'would you like to proceed' in publish_github_release_notes.sh
body:
`[Y/n]` implies Y is the default, but in fact N is the default.
